column4: alright, how bout this, is there software similar to hardware manager in windows for gnome so that i can see the list of hardware/drivers?
im just lookin to get my soundcard to work man lol
try and reboot: sudo apt-get install linux-backports-modules-alsa-karmic-generic
how do you "reply" to a specific person like you are doing to me?
reboot, run alsamixer, run something that makes sound and toggle controls around alsamixer to check their effect
what are you trying to test sound with? did you install restricted extras?
i havnt installed any restricted extracts, and i tried to test sound with alsamixer like you suggested, tweaking levels. I assume it would make a "ping" noise when changed...
no it doesn't make any sounds by itself..
told you to run something that makes sound like a music player, AND then tinker with alsamixer
no, still no sound, at least from youtube videos...
unmute (M key) and max everything in alsamixer
individual controls could be muted too
if i switch off jack detect i am now getting a slight hum from speakers, but that is it. I tried every combo of on/off and i cant get sound to work
are you running karmic or lucid?
